metaDescription: Case study: Product owner for mobile application features at MVP Healthcare, managing backlog and stakeholder alignment for healthcare digital transformation initiatives.

hero.title: MVP Healthcare Mobile Platform
hero.subtitle: Product owner for mobile application features, managing backlog and stakeholder alignment for healthcare digital transformation initiatives serving 700,000+ members.

sections.title: Project Overview
sections.challenge: MVP Healthcare, serving over 700,000 members across Vermont and northern New York, needed to modernize their digital member experience while navigating complex healthcare regulations, diverse member needs, and integration challenges with legacy systems.
sections.approach: As product owner for mobile features, I managed the strategic roadmap and stakeholder alignment for initiatives that would transform how members interact with their healthcare benefits, from enrollment to claims management.

phases.title: Member Research & Journey Mapping
phases.description: Conducted comprehensive member research to understand current healthcare journey pain points and digital readiness across diverse demographics.

phases.title: MVP Launch & Core Features
phases.description: Prioritized and launched essential mobile features that provided immediate member value while establishing technical foundation.
outcomes: Claims tracking and digital ID cards

phases.title: Advanced Health Management
phases.description: Expanded platform with sophisticated health management tools integrated with clinical workflows and member care plans.

insights.title: Clinical vs. Digital Perspectives
insights.description: Healthcare product ownership requires translating between clinical best practices and digital user experience expectations.

insights.title: Privacy as Product Feature
insights.description: HIPAA compliance and privacy requirements can become competitive advantages when built thoughtfully into user experience.

insights.title: Accessibility-First Healthcare
insights.description: Healthcare members have diverse abilities and technology comfort levels. Designing for accessibility creates better experiences for all users.
